ygData.subject: Re: FW: [EQ_SMITHS] Studs and studded leather armor...
ygData.msgSnippet: ... A freind of mine is a Ranger/Tailor and they have had extensive talks about studed/reenforced on the Ranger mailing list he is on,  He and I are also in
ygData.messageBody:
On Sun, 16 May 1999, Shawn A. Chesak wrote:

> From: "Shawn A. Chesak" <baalzebub@...>
>
>
>
> There are several classes that CAN'T wear banded. So there is a definite
> market for the studded and reinforced leather. But, as mentioned before, if
> the studded isn't any better than leather, it is more of a skill-builder
> than anything. I imagine sales on reinforced would be quite nice, however.
>

A freind of mine is a Ranger/Tailor and they have had extensive talks about
studed/reenforced on the Ranger mailing list he is on, He and I are also in
bussiness selling the stuff in the Kelethin area (I supply the studs, we
both go kill the puma's for the pelts, and he makes the armour) from what I
have been told the ac is a little better on some pieces of armour, where
studed and reinforced become usefull is in their absourbtion. as an example
say in leather you get hit for 8 points of dammage the exact same hit in
studed armour would do 6 damm and 4 damm in reinforced. This of course is
just an example of the numbers which will probally vary.... because of this
extra absourbtion and better AC studed/reinforced is well worth it for the
people who can't use better.
